labels.analysis: The Flux ImageGen Server is designed for generating and manipulating images using AI models. Its primary functionality revolves around creating images from text prompts, returning them in various formats, and managing different image generation models. The tools provided indicate a focus on AI-driven image creation and management, which would be useful for applications requiring dynamic visual content generation.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "AI/ML Tools" is chosen because the server's core functionality is based on AI models for image generation. "Content Creation" is included as a secondary label since the server's image generation capabilities are directly useful for content creation workflows. There is no need for a custom label as the predefined categories cover the server's functionality adequately.

tools.name: generateImageUrl
tools.description: Generate an image URL from a text prompt

prompt.description: The text description of the image to generate

model.description: Model name to use for generation (default: "flux"). Available options: "flux", "sdxl", "sd3", "sd15", "flux-schnell", "flux-dev"

enhance.description: Whether to enhance the prompt using an LLM before generating (default: true)

safe.description: Whether to apply content filtering (default: false)

tools.name: generateImage
tools.description: Generate an image, return the base64-encoded data, and save to a file by default

prompt.description: The text description of the image to generate

model.description: Model name to use for generation (default: "flux"). Available options: "flux, "turbo" (sdxl),

enhance.description: Whether to enhance the prompt using an LLM before generating (default: true)

safe.description: Whether to apply content filtering (default: false)

outputPath.description: Directory path where to save the image (default: "./mcpollinations-output")

fileName.description: Name of the file to save (without extension, default: generated from prompt)

format.description: Image format to save as (png, jpeg, jpg, webp - default: png)

server_info_crawled.name: Flux ImageGen Server
server_info_crawled.author: @falahgs/flux-imagegen-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Generate and manipulate images effortlessly using advanced AI models. Create image URLs, generate images directly, and manage multiple image generation models with ease. Enhance your applications with high-performance, customizable image generation capabilities.

safe.description: Whether to apply content filtering (default: false)

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@falahgs/flux-imagegen-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
